title: Drawing, Design for Serving Table with Upper and Lower Shelves, 1900–05
title_raw: Design for Serving Table with Upper and Lower Shelves
markings: Watermark across verso bottom : ORIENTAL LINEN
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, lower center: Mhy [for "mahogany"?] [inverted "V"] = E / [inverted "V"] [square with dot at center in red ink] V / UXS; at upper right of image, with arrows pointing to right corner of top shelf and to table top: inlay; across left edge and upper center of image, numerical notations indicating dimensions
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Rectangular table top with single drawer center; raised on 2 columnar legs at front and 2 plain straight legs at back, all 4 terminating in low bracket feet; conforming lower shelf with molded edges attaches just above floor level; molded upper shelf raised on 2 pair of short columnar supports at front.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Serving Table with Upper and Lower Shelves, 1900–05. Graphite on thin cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-81
